summary: Radioactive (Peter Parker x Reader)
title: Radioactive (Peter Parker x Reader)
body:
Summary: When Peter gets hurt during an alien invasion it’s up to you to save the day, but at what cost?

Author: Madison

Words: 1,220

A/n: So I originally wrote this for Anna but i thought it would be fun to share. I also wrote this before Infinity War came out so this obviously doesn’t happen but I figured it was fun to play with none the less.

“Why? Why would you do that?” You screamed at Peter as you held him close attempting to put pressure on his fresh wound.

“I couldn’t let him get to you” He mumbled shifting his position in the rubble.

“I could’ve handled myself” You yelled more in fear than actual anger.

You couldn’t blame Peter all that much. If you saw Thanos and his alien goons heading towards him you would’ve sprung into action too. Normally you’d be over analyzing the situation wondering if Peter coming to your aide meant he liked you. This time you were far too concerned to even have the slightest thought of your schoolgirl crush on your mind.

One of the aliens had plunged his ugly claws right into Peter’s chest. Blood was pouring out of the wound and Peter’s breath was ragged and forced. You had to do something quickly; he had lost a lot of blood.

“Peter you have to stand for me. I can’t carry you” You said brushing a stray hair out of his eyes.

“I don’t think I can” He mumbled.

“Please” You begged him but stopped as another alien came charging your way. You quickly grabbed a broken piece of concrete and threw it at the creature with a grunt sending him crumbling to the ground. “You have to try. For me” You said turning back to Peter with tears threatening to spill from your eyes at any minute.

Peter’s eyes fluttered open weakly at your last statement. “I’ll try”

With that the webslinger did the best he could to push himself off the pavement with a moan as you wrapped his arm around your shoulder and your arm around his waist to steady him. He stumbled along as you tried to guide him as carefully as possible towards the rest of you team who was very much preoccupied.

“Strange” You called to the sorcerer. “Peter is hurt I need to get him back to Bruce” You yelled through the smoke. Peter had crumpled at your feet and was now vomiting. The Doctor turned his head slightly and with a wave of his hand you were back at the Avengers Base.

Peter had now completely collapsed on the floor and was non-responsive. “Bruce” Your scream echoing through the empty halls of the base. “Come on Peter stay with me” You whispered gently caressing his cheek with your thumb.

“Y/n?” Bruce called entering the lobby with a concerned look in his eyes. “What happened?”

“Peter got stabbed by one of the aliens. He’s lost a lot of blood” You said watching as Bruce knelt down and started taking Peter’s pulse.

“He’s still breathing but he doesn’t have long” Bruce said scooping Peter up in his arms and carrying him to med bay.

You followed closely behind finally taking in what kind of state you were in. Peter’s blood was soaked all over your suit and had ended up smeared on your hands, face, and arms. In all honesty you were a mess.

It didn’t take long for Bruce to hook Peter up to all sorts of medical equipment. He stitched the wound the best he could and checked Peter’s vitals again with a frown.

“What is it?” You asked realizing something was wrong.

“I was able to stop the bleeding and stabilize the wound but he’s lost too much blood and his body can’t produce it fast enough” He said with a sigh. “He’s lucky he’s still alive as is, any normal person and he’d already be dead”

“Well can’t we just give him some blood?” You said thinking of blood donors.

“Peter’s blood is radioactive if we mix normal blood with his I don’t think his body would accept it” Bruce said rubbing his eyes.

“Can we use yours?” You ask innocently.

“Are you kidding?” Bruce asks in disbelief. “There’s no way in hell I’m mixing radioactivity with gamma radiation”

“Then what do you propose?” You said frustrated that there seemed to be no solution. Bruce was silent for a moment. “Wait can you make radioactive blood?”

Bruce looked up for a minute. “That might work. But I’d need tons of blood since the radioactive charge would diminish some of it during bonding. I don’t think Peter has enough time to wait for me to get my hands on it”

“Use mine” You said instantly.

“Y/n no” Bruce said shaking his head. “Uh uh. It’s too dangerous. There’s no telling how much blood I’d actually need”

“Please Bruce” You begged. “He’s running out of options and I want to save him. Please”

Bruce sighed. “Shit. Alright fine. Hop in that bed and roll up your sleeve. But if you get too low I’m pulling you out” You nodded and did as you were told. Within minutes you were hooked up to a machine that pumped blood directly from your arm into a radioactive chamber and then directly into Peter. “If you start to feel sick you need to tell me. Do you understand?” He asked to which you nodded. Knowing full well no matter what you were going to save Peter.

You felt fine for about five minutes and shortly there after you felt weak and dizzy. You could hear Peter making quiet noises which was the only thing keeping you going. “How are we doing?” You asked Bruce as strong as you could.

“He’s actually doing really well” Bruce nodded checking his vitals. “I actually think we’re almost done” You smiled to yourself hoping you could hold on that long. A few more minutes passed and it took everything in you to keep from passing out. “All done” Bruce said pulling the needle from your arm. “How are you feeling?” You started to speak but only garble came out as you slipped into unconsciousness. “Damn it Y/n” Was the last thing you heard.

When Peter finally woke he blinked his eyes a few times before pushing himself in an upright position. His hand went to his chest and felt the bulge and the sharp pain of the wound. He cringed as he turned himself to the side to get off the bed. What he say next to him made him sick to his stomach. You were lying in a bed soaked in blood all over and you were pale as a ghost. “Oh god” He mumbled to himself rushing over to you. “Y/n” He said caressing your face softly. “What have I done?”

“It’s not as bad as it looks” You croaked with a smile. “The blood is actually yours”

“Mine?” He asked somewhat shocked. “Why are you so pale though?” He asked not understanding.

“Because my blood is in you” You said gesturing to the machine between your two beds. “You had lost so much that Bruce needed to find a way to give you more, naturally it had to be radioactive”

“You’re so stupid” He said sitting down on your bed with a huff of irritation. “Why would you do that?”

Here goes nothing you thought to yourself. “Maybe because I really care about you as more than just a friend”

Peter was shocked at first but quickly leaned over and pressed his lips on yours softly. “I love you too, but don’t you ever do something like this again”

“Try and stop me” You teased.

summary: PLEASE DO FLUFF 1 & 21 FOR ME IN THE SAME ONE THANK U ILY DJCIJANZNFKAE
question: PLEASE DO FLUFF 1 & 21 FOR ME IN THE SAME ONE THANK U ILY DJCIJANZNFKAE
answer:
FLUFF 1 IS SO FUCKING FUNNY HAHAAA. ALSO i’m using peter bc I LOVE THE IDEA OF STARK!READER SAYING THIS TO THE AVENGERS OMG

#1: “It doesn’t matter if you have stupid powers or whatever the hell you guys want to call it, I have a frying pan. Have you guys ever seen Tangled? The frying pan always works.”

#21: “Guess who broke their nose! Me. It’s me. I broke my nose.”

jordans blurb night

she walked into the room, seeing all the avengers sprawled out onto various pieces of furniture. thor on the couch, sam, clint and natasha on the other couch, cap and her father in the two chairs, wanda and vision on the floor, bruce and peter… no one knew where they disappeared to. 

“the hell happened to all of you?” she asked, chuckling a little.

“it’s called saving the world, kid,” sam said,”something you can’t do.”

“i totally could.” she said, crossing her arms, taking it as a challenge.

“oh here we go, another stark.” clint complained and she shot him a look.

“you don’t have powers.” vision said.

she shrugged,”it doesn’t matter if you have stupid powers or whatever the hell you guys want to call it, i have a frying pan. have you guys ever seen tangled? the frying pan always works.”

tony rolled his eyes as some of the other avengers laughed,”she has a point, tony.”

“i’m gonna go find peter.”

nat, thor, and clint all continued to make kissy noises and she rolled her eyes and flipped off the three of them. 

she rolled her eyes before moving towards the stairs, going up to his room to see if he was there. sure enough, when she opened the door and saw his shirtless back, she smiled to herself.

she closed the door behind her before wrapping her arms around his bare torso.

“hey.” she said, placing a light kiss on his shoulder blade. he smiled.

“hi.”

“why’s your voice sound like that?” she asked, noticing the stuffiness in his voice. he turned around, toilet paper in his nose and she rolled her eyes.

“guess who broke their nose! me. it’s me. i broke my nose.”

she laughed,”of course you did, spider-boy.”

tags: let me know what you think
summary: Trust issues?  (Ch. 6 Cure for Nightmares) When peter first walked into the Compound he was excited to see Tony he hadn’t seen...
body:
Trust issues?

(Ch. 6 Cure for Nightmares)

When peter first walked into the Compound he was excited to see Tony he hadn’t seen him in over a week since last weekend Peter decided to spend with Ned, with Tony’s blessing of course. Peter got off the elevator and almost walked into Clint who was standing in the middle of the common room.

“Oh sorry kid didn’t mean to be in the way” Clint said with a grin helping peter to his feet

“It’s alright Clint I wasn’t paying attention I didn’t even know you were in town” Peter said noticing Clint had his uniform on.

“I just got in town earlier today kid I’ll be hanging for a bit” Clint said smiling

“That’s cool is there a mission do I need my suit I can grab it quick it’s in my room” peter said excitedly

“Kid I’m not the one who can give you the clearance for that that’s your dad, plus I don’t think everyone is needed” Clint said smirking grabbing his arrows.

Peter grin dropped as Tony, Steve, and Natasha walked in the room all suited up.

“Hey kiddo is Legolas playing nice?” tony quipped

“Hey I take offence to that stark I would never harm your kid” Clint said sticking out his tongue

“Just playing with you Barton” tony said laughing

Peter got up looked tony in the face “Tony can I please go too you said I’m avenger and so far I’ve barely been on any missions” peter pleaded

“Pete so far we haven’t needed you yet” tony said sighing “for example today it’s just me, birdbrain, capsicle, and Natalie, it’s a minor mission”

“If it’s a minor mission why can’t I go I’ve probably handled worse on the streets of Queens” peter asked crossing his arms

“Just looking out for you kid were going out of state and I don’t know how long the mission will last I think probably on till tomorrow but I don’t know something could surprise us it last longer, I rather not have May castrate me” tony said looking away.

“Mr., Stark I’m calling Bullshit say what the real reason is already? You don’t trust me to be on the missions do you?” peter said raising his voice

Tony could tell peter was annoyed with him it was the first time he called him Mr., stark in months.

“Pete of course I trust you” tony said simply

“You don’t trust me. You never let me help even though I’m stronger than you. You treat me like a child even now. Even though I’m 17 and have died”

That complete stopped tony in his tracks, the others didn’t even attempt moving or talking, they just stared in silence.

“Kid I trust my life in your hands ok. It pains me to bench you because of your potential but for my sanity I have to at least sometimes, I’m sorry” tony said weakly.

“I need more of a reason then that tony” peter said shorty

“Kid after I got you back after you went back to being a friendly neighborhood Spiderman literally every time you got even the smallest injury I nearly had a heart attack. I obviously knew your healing you’d be fine but my mind didn’t process it. kid I know you want to be on the missions with us and I want that for you to but you got to wait until I’m in a better state because if you went now literally the whole time I’d be worrying over you I wouldn’t be able to focus on anything but you even if you didn’t get hurt if you did I don’t think my heart could take it.” Tony said quietly looking away from peter.

Peter knew tony worried over him but he never thought it had gotten to this extreme and sighed, and walked over to tony.

“Tony look at me” tony listened “I never knew I worried you so much I’m sorry but if you bottle it up I can’t know. I accept not going today that’s fine but future minor missions you need to be more open to me helping ok? I’ll do whatever will make you more comfortable like training, updating my suit whatever; you can’t shelter me forever ok?”  

“Yes peter that would help” tony said with a grin

“As far as your issues you really need to talk to a professional” peter said calmly

“I’ve tried in the past they never work for me” tony said sighing

“From what pepper has told me you used Bruce once and he’s not trained as a therapist you need to use an actual therapist tony it will help” peter said pleading

“Ok kid once I get back ill start looking for one alright?” tony said with a smile

“Good and you can always talk to me too” peter said leaning forward to hug Tony

Tony tensed for a moment before he accepted the hug

“Thanks Pete” tony said happily

Clint, Steve, and Natasha all looked at each other dumbfounded they were expecting a huge fight but ended in a hug.

“If this bonding moment is over tony we really need to be going” Natasha said with a grin

Tony let go of peter, peter looked a little embarrassed.

“Yeah Stark you can be a dad later right now I want to kick some ass” Clint said

“Ok let go then Legolas” tony said walking towards them.

Peter started walking towards his room to work on his homework. When he heard tony call his name, he turned to the elevator

“Hey Pete once I get back how about a movie and game night? We can watch Aliens and I can kick your butt in Mario Kart.” Tony said with a sly grin

“You’re on but I’m going to be the one kicking your ass Tony” Peter quipped

“We shall see brat” tony said as the elevator doors closed

“It seriously the funniest thing seeing you as a dad” Clint said chuckling as the elevator descended “Never thought I see the day”

“You’re not the only one” Natasha added as they walked out of the elevator.

“I never imagined myself as a dad either” tony said shrugging

As they entered the quinjet Steve spoke

“Hey I’ve witnessed him letting the kid sleep on him while watching a movie so yeah its official you’re a dad.”

“Shut up capsicle” tony said entering the cockpit

“I definitely need to witness their game night, should be hilarious seeing Stark losing” Clint said taking his seat.

Peter knew tony worried over him but he never thought it had gotten to this extreme and sighed, and walked over to tony.

“Tony look at me” tony listened “I never knew I worried you so much I’m sorry but if you bottle it up I can’t know. I accept not going today that’s fine but future minor missions you need to be more open to me helping ok? I’ll do whatever will make you more comfortable like training, updating my suit whatever; you can’t shelter me forever ok?”  

“Yes peter that would help” tony said with a grin

“As far as your issues you really need to talk to a professional” peter said calmly

“I’ve tried in the past they never work for me” tony said sighing

“From what pepper has told me you used Bruce once and he’s not trained as a therapist you need to use an actual therapist tony it will help” peter said pleading

“Ok kid once I get back ill start looking for one alright?” tony said with a smile

“Good and you can always talk to me too” peter said leaning forward to hug Tony

Tony tensed for a moment before he accepted the hug

“Thanks Pete” tony said happily

Clint, Steve, and Natasha all looked at each other dumbfounded they were expecting a huge fight but ended in a hug.

“If this bonding moment is over tony we really need to be going” Natasha said with a grin

Tony let go of peter, peter looked a little embarrassed.

“Yeah Stark you can be a dad later right now I want to kick some ass” Clint said

“Ok let go then Legolas” tony said walking towards them.

Peter started walking towards his room to work on his homework. When he heard tony call his name, he turned to the elevator

“Hey Pete once I get back how about a movie and game night? We can watch Aliens and I can kick your butt in Mario Kart.” Tony said with a sly grin

“You’re on but I’m going to be the one kicking your ass Tony” Peter quipped

“We shall see brat” tony said as the elevator doors closed

“It seriously the funniest thing seeing you as a dad” Clint said chuckling as the elevator descended “Never thought I see the day”

“You’re not the only one” Natasha added as they walked out of the elevator.

“I never imagined myself as a dad either” tony said shrugging

As they entered the quinjet Steve spoke

“Hey I’ve witnessed him letting the kid sleep on him while watching a movie so yeah its official you’re a dad.”

“Shut up capsicle” tony said entering the cockpit

“I definitely need to witness their game night, should be hilarious seeing Stark losing” Clint said taking his seat.

summary: Tired
title: Tired
body:
Summary: Peter’s tired, his identity is revealed, kinda, and Tony takes the credit. 

Word Count: 1000

Sometimes Peter realized that Tony didn’t think he was good enough. It wasn’t a big thing, wasn’t something he saw often- after all, Tony was very kind with him, but… he often was treated like a kid in a sense, never really seen as someone who could handle himself in a fight. And he could! He really really could! But Tony… Tony didn’t see that in him. He just saw a kid.

It wasn’t a fun thing to realize, knowing your idol thought you just someone to protect, but Peter wanted to prove to him who he was, what he was, how good he could be. It would be tough, he thought, having to do something like that, while also knowing that he would never be as good as Tony probably would want from him. Still, he had to prove it.

He got his chance when his school was attacked. Albeit, it wasn’t a good thing, but it worked with what he wanted from this world. It was sucky, but Peter told himself to run when they were attacked, making himself out to be a coward, and hid in the bathroom, change, and left his bag there. Ned would get it, he was sure enough of that.

Whatever this thing was, in was nearly fifteen times Peter’s size. It looked like it was made of some sort of oozy substance and didn’t seem to be sentient. Which meant there was something bigger at play here, but Peter could ignore that for the time being so that he could focus on defeating this one.

He swung out the window, rolling and landing a few feet from the monster. He saw students being lead out the back, the thing out front, and Peter moved back to the students fist, swinging by teachers quickly, asking, in a slightly deeper voice than he own was, if there were any students they knew were missing.

Fucking Flash. Flash was missing, he was the link, he was still inside, dammit. The one person he might want to leave behind in this type of thing was the one who was stuck. With that, he raced into the building, ducking through various rooms, eyes darting around behind the mask. Damn him.

Flash was stuck on the second story in a closet of one of the rooms. Luckily the thing hadn’t managed to get to him quite yet, which left Peter to have to fling him over his shoulder-Flash was always was difficult even when it was going to save his life-and run with him, swinging quickly and skidding out back with him, tossing him to the ground, maybe a little more… rough than he had to be with him.

Still, he couldn’t have been prepared for Flash to hang on to his mask, nor the suddenness of the monster grabbing him suddenly and yanking him back. His head was suddenly free of his mask, but he couldn’t focus on that, couldn’t focus on the gasps of the students below him.

Instead, he squirmed in the thing’s grasp, trying to fight off it’s grip. He shifted, managing to get a hand free, and shot webs at what looked like it’s face. The thing stumbled back, dropping Peter, who didn’t have time to swing himself out of the way and into safety, smacking face first into the ground. He scrambled up quickly, slinging himself to the roof and firing at the creature again, shivering a bit, covering it’s eye with webs.

The thing pawed at it self, and Peter took his chance, slinging himself onto the creature and wrapping himself around it quickly, feet kicking a bit in order to get himself around the thing over and over and over again.

The thing fell as Peter caught it’s legs, and he slung out of the way, rolling to a wheezing stop next to Flash, who clutched the mask in his hands and stared with wide eyes. There was a thud, and he watched the creature fall, before he struggled to his feet, spat blood onto the floor and snatched his mask back from Flash. Flash blinked, tried to grab it back, for whatever reason, but Peter had it on now. He looked around a moment, seeing Tony coming in for a landing quickly. News was just getting there, and… luckily, it looked as if no one had caught him with his mask off. He turned, addressing the group of teachers and students.

“Uhm… yeah, you, you never saw who I was. Could, y'know, use you guys as leverage, and, uhm… they don’t mind killing people, so yeah… don’t tell anyone who you saw under this mask.” With that, he slung into the school, rolled into the bathroom, changing back into his normal clothes quickly.

He slung his bag over his shoulder, ducked out the back and joined Ned standing on the side, staring at him.

“Dude.”

“I know. It sucks. Flash knows, he’s never gonna leave me alone about it.”

“You told us we might die if we say anything.”

“Which could be true for all I know, Ned, it’s not exactly… a good thing.”

News cameras where everywhere now, Iron Man Suits lifting the creature and flying off with it. It wasn’t a good idea, but Peter huffed and left quickly. He didn’t want to see this. Even if there were webs all over that thing, Tony would get the credit for his take down. He didn’t want to deal with this at the moment.

He just wanted to take a nap, is all. It would be fine once he did that. He huffed, starting how, sighing softly. He was just… tired.

Tired of being a hero, if he were being truly honest.

Tired of… basically everything.

He sighed, looking up at the sky a moment. Cloudless, sun shining. Nothing there going by at all. He huffed, shaking his head. They didn’t need him at all. He shook the thought from his head, and thus, continued right on home.

“Which could be true for all I know, Ned, it’s not exactly… a good thing.”

Word Count: 1000

Sometimes Peter realized that Tony didn’t think he was good enough. It wasn’t a big thing, wasn’t something he saw often- after all, Tony was very kind with him, but… he often was treated like a kid in a sense, never really seen as someone who could handle himself in a fight. And he could! He really really could! But Tony… Tony didn’t see that in him. He just saw a kid.

It wasn’t a fun thing to realize, knowing your idol thought you just someone to protect, but Peter wanted to prove to him who he was, what he was, how good he could be. It would be tough, he thought, having to do something like that, while also knowing that he would never be as good as Tony probably would want from him. Still, he had to prove it.

He got his chance when his school was attacked. Albeit, it wasn’t a good thing, but it worked with what he wanted from this world. It was sucky, but Peter told himself to run when they were attacked, making himself out to be a coward, and hid in the bathroom, change, and left his bag there. Ned would get it, he was sure enough of that.

Whatever this thing was, in was nearly fifteen times Peter’s size. It looked like it was made of some sort of oozy substance and didn’t seem to be sentient. Which meant there was something bigger at play here, but Peter could ignore that for the time being so that he could focus on defeating this one.

He swung out the window, rolling and landing a few feet from the monster. He saw students being lead out the back, the thing out front, and Peter moved back to the students fist, swinging by teachers quickly, asking, in a slightly deeper voice than he own was, if there were any students they knew were missing.

Fucking Flash. Flash was missing, he was the link, he was still inside, dammit. The one person he might want to leave behind in this type of thing was the one who was stuck. With that, he raced into the building, ducking through various rooms, eyes darting around behind the mask. Damn him.

Flash was stuck on the second story in a closet of one of the rooms. Luckily the thing hadn’t managed to get to him quite yet, which left Peter to have to fling him over his shoulder-Flash was always was difficult even when it was going to save his life-and run with him, swinging quickly and skidding out back with him, tossing him to the ground, maybe a little more… rough than he had to be with him.

Still, he couldn’t have been prepared for Flash to hang on to his mask, nor the suddenness of the monster grabbing him suddenly and yanking him back. His head was suddenly free of his mask, but he couldn’t focus on that, couldn’t focus on the gasps of the students below him.

Instead, he squirmed in the thing’s grasp, trying to fight off it’s grip. He shifted, managing to get a hand free, and shot webs at what looked like it’s face. The thing stumbled back, dropping Peter, who didn’t have time to swing himself out of the way and into safety, smacking face first into the ground. He scrambled up quickly, slinging himself to the roof and firing at the creature again, shivering a bit, covering it’s eye with webs.

The thing pawed at it self, and Peter took his chance, slinging himself onto the creature and wrapping himself around it quickly, feet kicking a bit in order to get himself around the thing over and over and over again.

The thing fell as Peter caught it’s legs, and he slung out of the way, rolling to a wheezing stop next to Flash, who clutched the mask in his hands and stared with wide eyes. There was a thud, and he watched the creature fall, before he struggled to his feet, spat blood onto the floor and snatched his mask back from Flash. Flash blinked, tried to grab it back, for whatever reason, but Peter had it on now. He looked around a moment, seeing Tony coming in for a landing quickly. News was just getting there, and… luckily, it looked as if no one had caught him with his mask off. He turned, addressing the group of teachers and students.

“Uhm… yeah, you, you never saw who I was. Could, y'know, use you guys as leverage, and, uhm… they don’t mind killing people, so yeah… don’t tell anyone who you saw under this mask.” With that, he slung into the school, rolled into the bathroom, changing back into his normal clothes quickly.

He slung his bag over his shoulder, ducked out the back and joined Ned standing on the side, staring at him.

“Dude.”

“I know. It sucks. Flash knows, he’s never gonna leave me alone about it.”

“You told us we might die if we say anything.”

“Which could be true for all I know, Ned, it’s not exactly… a good thing.”

News cameras where everywhere now, Iron Man Suits lifting the creature and flying off with it. It wasn’t a good idea, but Peter huffed and left quickly. He didn’t want to see this. Even if there were webs all over that thing, Tony would get the credit for his take down. He didn’t want to deal with this at the moment.

He just wanted to take a nap, is all. It would be fine once he did that. He huffed, starting how, sighing softly. He was just… tired.

Tired of being a hero, if he were being truly honest.

Tired of… basically everything.

He sighed, looking up at the sky a moment. Cloudless, sun shining. Nothing there going by at all. He huffed, shaking his head. They didn’t need him at all. He shook the thought from his head, and thus, continued right on home.
